com.WAT.airbnb.rest.users.messages

Class MessageControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.WAT.airbnb.rest.users.messages.MessageControl

  • @Path(value="/message")
public class MessageControl
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all messaging operations Paths: /send/{receiverId} /delete/{type}/{messageId} /receive/{received}

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageControl() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteMessage(int type, int messageId, java.lang.String token)
      In the messages table in the DB, there exists a column named deleted of type char(2) which holds 3 possible combinations: 00 - Neither the sender or receiver of the message have deleted this message 01 - The sender has deleted the message (and thus should not receive it in the message list anymore) 10 - The receiver has deleted the message (and thus should not receive it in the message list anymore)
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getMessages(int received, java.lang.String token) 
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response sendMessage(int recId, java.lang.String json)
      Creates a new message in the database

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessage

        @Path(value="/send/{receiverId}")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response sendMessage(@PathParam(value="receiverId")
                                                                                                                           int recId,
                                                                                                                           java.lang.String json)
        Creates a new message in the database

      • deleteMessage

        @Path(value="/delete/{type}/{messageId}")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="text/plain")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteMessage(@PathParam(value="type")
                                                                                                                               int type,
                                                                                                                               @PathParam(value="messageId")
                                                                                                                               int messageId,
                                                                                                                               java.lang.String token)
        In the messages table in the DB, there exists a column named deleted of type char(2) which holds 3 possible combinations: 00 - Neither the sender or receiver of the message have deleted this message 01 - The sender has deleted the message (and thus should not receive it in the message list anymore) 10 - The receiver has deleted the message (and thus should not receive it in the message list anymore)
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the user that deletes the message (saves us an access to the databse since the client knows if it was deleted from the received or sent messages list)

      • getMessages

        @Path(value="/receive/{received}")
 @POST
 @Consumes(value="text/plain")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getMessages(@PathParam(value="received")
                                                                                                                      int received,
                                                                                                                      java.lang.String token)
        Parameters:
        received - Takes the values 0/1 depending on whether the client has requested their received/sent messages respectively
        Returns:
        A list of non-deleted messages sent/received by the user
